info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 6:51PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Transylvania, northwestern Henderson, southern Haywood and southern Buncombe Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 651 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Waynesville to 3 miles east of Downtown Asheville. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Downtown Asheville, Waynesville, East Asheville, Arden, West Asheville, North Asheville, Mills River, Woodfin, Fletcher and Swannanoa. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
